pr_title: DHFPROD-4105: Add API for linking/removing artifacts from steps

timeline.bodyText: I think it's easier just to rethrow this or declare throws Exception on the method.
timeline.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText: Removed the catch, so the exception will be thrown.
replies.author: ryanjdew

timeline.bodyText: This seems a little awkward for a URL. I can see flowName/steps/stepId/link, as the link of a step is an actual thing that's referenceable. But I think the artifact properties should go into the RequestBody, which can be declared as a JsonNode - or by using ArtifactTypeInfo possibly?
timeline.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText: Looking at this again, I think if there's already a pattern to toss all the inputs into the URL, then this is fine. But I feel it'd be cleaner if there was an "ArtifactLink" class with type/name/version properties and a RequestBody annotation on it.
replies.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText: I'm leaving the API as is. The reasoning behind that is that the DELETE method won't allow for a body describing the link to be removed and it seems odd to me to have different URL patterns for linking and unlinking
replies.author: ryanjdew

replies.bodyText: That's a good point, sounds good.
replies.author: rjrudin
